botanical_details.genus: Capsicum are annual or perennial plants, with simple, alternate leaves, and tubular or bell-shaped flowers. They are grown for their glossy, many-seeded edible fruits, including chilli and bell peppers, and as indoor ornamental plants

how_to_grow.cultivation: Grow in any fertile, moisture-retentive soil that warms quickly in spring in a sunny sheltered site. Ideally suited to containers or growbags. More cultivation advice can be found in Peppers in Vegetable cultivation
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by seed indoors at 18-21°C, optimum temperatures for seedlings are 18°C (day) and16°C (night). Prick out then plant outdoors in beds, pots or grow bags after hardening off
how_to_grow.pruning: Staking may be necessary if a heavy crop of large peppers are produced
how_to_grow.pests: May be susceptible to aphids, glasshouse red spider mites and glasshouse whitefly
how_to_grow.diseases: May be susceptible to blossom end rot, grey mould (botrytis) and verticillium wilt
